channel.title: Home on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Home on My New Hugo Site

item.description: 1 1: Prostatitis Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 52 year-old man with PSA of 5.0 ng/mL. Prior negative biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a geographic crescentic region of mildly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal with associated early enhancement.

2 2: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 71 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 9.0 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posteromedial PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

3 3: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 74 year-old man with PSA of 5.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, although with associated focal early enhancement.

4 4: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 77 year-old man with PSA of 7.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posteromedial PZ demonstrates a region of focal decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal with associated focal early enhancement.

5 5: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 53 year-old man with PSA of 7.1 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, although without associated focal early enhancement.

6 6: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 68 year-old man with PSA of 5.7 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posteromedial PZ demonstrates a region of focal decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal.

7 7: Pseudolesion Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 66 year-old man with PSA of 7 ng/mL. On active surveillance (prior biopsy with Gleason score 3+3 tumor in one core) Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: No focal abnormality is identified.

8 8: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 42 year-old man with PSA of 2.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of moerately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

9 9: CZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 58 year-old man with PSA of 5.8 ng/ml. On active surveillance for Gleason score 3+3 tumor. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The lesion in the left central zone at the prostatic base demonstrates focal markedly reduced ADC and increased signal on the high b-value images, as well as corresponding focal early enhancement.

10 10: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 69 year-old man with PSA of 8.7 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and markedly increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

11 11: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 71 year-old man with PSA of 20.0 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior PZ demonstrates a large region of focal markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

12 12: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 63 year-old man with PSA of 7.8 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

13 13: TZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 54 year-old man with PSA of 18.0 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior TZ demonstrates a large region of non-rounded non-encapsulated decreased homogeneous moderately decreased T2 signal.

14 14: TZ PI-RADS 3 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 68 year-old man with PSA of 2.8 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left anterior TZ demonstrates a non-rounded non-encapsulated region of moderately decreased T2 signal, although lacking the classic erased charcoal appearance to warrant a T2WI score of 4.

15 15: TZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 61 year-old man with PSA of 21.8 ng/mL. Prior negative biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior TZ demonstrates a non-rounded region of homogeneous moderately decreased T2 signal with ill-defined margins.

16 16: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 56 year-old man with PSA of 5.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

17 17: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 58 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 4.1 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement

18 18: TZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 61 year-old man with PSA of 21.8 ng/mL. Prior negative biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: Within the right anterior PZ and TZ is a large region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement and locally invasive behavior.

19 19: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 66 year-old man with PSA of 6.2 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterior PZ demonstrates a large region of markedly decreased ADC and markedly increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

20 20: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 74 year-old man with PSA of 6.4 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

21 21: PI-RADS 1 Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 65 year-old man with PSA of 4.8 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: No focal abnormality is identified. The region of decreased T2 signal and decreased ADC by the posterior midline base of the PZ has the typical appearance of the pseudolesion encountered in this location, postulated to relate to fascial/capsular thickening in the region of the ejaculatory ducts.

22 22: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 62 year-old man with PSA of 6.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posteromedial PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

23 23: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 65 year-old man with PSA of 3.4 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The posterior midline PZ demonstrates a focal region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

24 24: PZ PI-RADS 3 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 56 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 2.0 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posteromedial PZ demonstrates a focal region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

25 25: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 67 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 5.2 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

26 26: TZ PI-RADS 3 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 67 year-old man with PSA of 5.1 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The midline anterior TZ at the level of the distal apex demonstrates a peri-urethral lesion with non-rounded non-encapsulated homogeneous moderately decreased T2 signal, focal markedly decreased ADC, and markedly increased high b-value signal.

27 27: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 70 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 3.7 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

28 28: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 65 year-old man with PSA of 11.0 ng/mL. Prior negative biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posteromedial PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

29 29: Stromal BPH Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 67 year-old man with PSA of 4.7 ng/ml. No prior prostate biopsy Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The lesion in the left anterior transition zone demonstrates homogeneous mildly decreased T2 signal.

30 30: TZ PI-RADS 3 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 71 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 4.5 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior TZ demonstrates a region of homogeneous moderately decreased T2 signal, although lacking the classic “erased charcoal” appearance of TZ tumors on T2WI.

31 31: PI-RADS 1 Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 53 year-old man with PSA of 4.9 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: No focal abnormality is identified. DCE demonstrates symmetric diffuse bilateral early enhancement in the PZ.

32 32: PZ PI-RADS 3 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 76 year-old man on active surveillance of prostate cancer. PSA of 2.2 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posteromedial PZ demonstrates a subcapsular crescentic region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, although without associated focal early enhancement.

33 33: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 65 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 1.8 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a small region of focal moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

34 34: PZ PI-RADS 3 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 59 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 5.0 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, although without associated focal early enhancement.

35 35: Extruded BPH Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 70 year-old man with PSA of 6.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ lesion has a broad interface with the PZ, a spherical shape, and an internal T2-hyperintense focus.

36 36: PI-RADS 1 Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 53 year-old man with PSA of 5.2 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: No focal abnormality is identified. The mildly heterogeneous signal intensity on T2WI, as well as diffuse streaky early enhancement bilaterally on DCE, without any associated ADC/DCE abnormality, may represent benign reactive or inflammatory changes and is not deemed suspicious for tumor.

37 37: Extruded BPH Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 71 year-old man with PSA of 11 ng/mL. Prior negative biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posteromedial PZ lesion has a spherical shape and heterogeneous signal intensity with numerous internal T2-hyperintense foci.

38 38: Prostatitis Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 66 year-old man with PSA of 7.8 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left apical posteromedial PZ demonstrates a geographic region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

39 39: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 65 year-old man with PSA of 9.3 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

40 40: TZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 75 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 5.9 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterior TZ demonstrates a non-rounded non-encapsulated focal region of homogeneous decreased T2 signal (darker than the remainder of the TZ) also showing focal markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal.

41 41: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 57 year-old man with PSA of 13.9 ng/mL. Prior negative biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

42 42: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 67 year-old man with PSA of 5.9 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posteromedial PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

43 43: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 55 year-old man with PSA of 3.7 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior peripheral zone demonstrates focal markedly reduced ADC and markedly increased signal on the high b-value images.

44 44: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 72 year-old man with PSA of 6.7 ng/mL. Prior negative prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The midline posterior PZ demonstrates a large mass demonstrating focal markedly decreased ADC, increased high b-value signal, and associated focal early enhancement.

45 45: Prostatitis Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 73 year-old man with PSA of 5.3 ng/mL (increased from baseline). No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posteromedial PZ demonstrates a geographic region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal.

46 46: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 57 year-old man with PSA of 6.6 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior PZ demonstrates a focal region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

47 47: TZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 79 year-old man with PSA of 11.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right anterior TZ demonstrates an elliptical non-encapsulated region of homogeneous moderately decreased T2 signal with focal marked decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal.

48 48: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 59 year-old man with PSA of 6.0 ng/mL. Prior negative prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterior PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

49 49: TZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 63 year-old man with PSA of 5.4 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterior TZ demonstrates a partially encapsulated region of moderately decreased T2 signal with similar texture as regions of BPH elsewhere in the TZ.

50 50: HGPIN Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 65 year-old man with PSA of 3.6 ng/mL (increased from baseline). Prior negative biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right PZ demonstrates a broad region of moderately decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal.

51 51: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 87 year-old man with PSA of 20.5 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The posterior PZ demonstrates a large mass with markedly decreased ADC, increased high b-value signal, and associated focal early enhancement.

52 52: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 72 year-old man on active surveillance for prostate cancer. PSA of 4.9 ng/mL. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal.

53 53: PZ PI-RADS 4 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 63 year-old man with PSA of 6.3 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

54 54: Normal central zone Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 53 year-old man with PSA of 10.8 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: No focal abnormality is identified on multi-parametric imaging. The posteromedial base demonstrates a crescentic shaped structure (solid arrows) with decreased T2 signal and decreased ADC, surrounding the ejaculatory ducts (dotted arrows).

55 55: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 56 year-old man with PSA of 4.3 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The left posterolateral PZ demonstrates a focal region of markedly decreased ADC and increased high b-value signal, with associated focal early enhancement.

56 56: PZ PI-RADS 5 tumor Show Title T2WI ADC DWI DCE 73 year-old man with PSA of 12.8 ng/mL. No prior prostate biopsy. Select the scroll, zoom/pan, and window/level buttons to perform each of these functions. Scroll and zoom using the middle mouse button or mouse wheel. Pan and window/level using the left mouse button.  See the solution Finding: The right posterior PZ demonstrates a focal region measuring over 15 mm showing markedly decreased ADC and markedly increased high b-value signal, as well as associated focal early enhancement.

PIRADS 2.0: what is new? Turkbey B, Choyke PL. Diagn Interv Radiol. 2015 Sep-Oct;21(5):382-4. PI-RADS version 2: what you need to know. Barrett T, Turkbey B, Choyke PL. Clin Radiol. 2015 Nov;70(11):1165-76 Synopsis of the PI-RADS v2 Guidelines for Multiparametric Prostate Magnetic Resonance Imaging and Recommendations for Use. Barentsz JO, Weinreb JC, Verma S, Thoeny HC, Tempany CM, Shtern F, Padhani AR, Margolis D, Macura KJ, Haider MA, Cornud F, Choyke PL.

Prostate Cancer: Interobserver Agreement and Accuracy with the Revised Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System at Multiparametric MR Imaging. Muller BG, Shih JH, Sankineni S, Marko J, Rais-Bahrami S, George AK, de la Rosette JJ, Merino MJ, Wood BJ, Pinto P, Choyke PL, Turkbey B. Radiology. 2015 Dec;277(3):741-50 Updated prostate imaging reporting and data system (PIRADS v2) recommendations for the detection of clinically significant prostate cancer using multiparametric MRI: critical evaluation using whole-mount pathology as standard of reference.

Radiologist, be aware: ten pitfalls that confound the interpretation of multiparametric prostate MRI. Rosenkrantz AB, Taneja SS. AJR Am J Roentgenol. 2014 Jan;202(1):109-20. Prostate cancer: top places where tumors hide on multiparametric MRI. Rosenkrantz AB, Verma S, Turkbey B. AJR Am J Roentgenol. 2015 Apr;204(4):W449-56. Benign Conditions That Mimic Prostate Carcinoma: MR Imaging Features with Histopathologic Correlation. Kitzing YX, Prando A, Varol C, Karczmar GS, Maclean F, Oto A. Radiographics.

1)  According to PI-RADS version 2, which of the following is the dominant sequence for determining the overall assessment category for a peripheral zone lesion? T2-weighted imaging Diffusion-weighted imaging Dynamic contrast-enhanced imaging MR spectroscopy Please provide an answer. 2)  According the PI-RADS version 2, which of the following is the dominant sequence for determining the overall assessment category for a transition zone lesion? T2-weighted imaging Diffusion-weighted imaging Dynamic contrast-enhanced imaging MR spectroscopy Please provide an answer.

item.title: About
item.description: Dr. Andrew Rosenkrantz is a Professor of Radiology and Urology and Director of Prostate Imaging at the NYU School of Medicine, NYU Langone Medical Center (NYULMC). He completed medical school at Albany Medical College, residency in Diagnostic Radiology at the University of Maryland Medical Center, and fellowship in Body MRI at NYULMC. His primary clinical research interest is the role of MRI in prostate cancer detection and characterization. As part of a multi-disciplinary team, he has researched numerous aspects of the optimization and validation of the acquisition, post-processing, and interpretation of prostate MRI.
